column1: The Battle of the Field of Celebrant was a battle in the late Third Age.
In the year 2510 of the Third Age
column2: the fierce Easterlings known as the Balchoth waged open war against a weakened Gondor
column3: and had already overrun most of  Rhovanion. Gondor had no allies left east of Anduin
column4: and against hope had sent the Red Arrow north to the Éothéod
column6: but they had received no reply.

column1: In 2510 the Balchoth crossed Anduin on numerous fords
column2: passing into the Wold in the north of the Gondorian province of Calenardhon. They met little resistance as Calenardhon had been mostly abandoned long before
column3: and by the time the Northern Army of Gondor appeared from the fortresses of Isengard
column4: Aglarond and other fortresses in the White Mountains the bulk of the Balchoth army had crossed.

column1: The North Army led by the Ruling Steward Cirion counter-attacked
column2: and was driven into the Wold
column3: cut off from the later reinforcements by the Balchoth host. By the time the Southern Army appeared
column4: the North Army had come under attack by an Orcs band Orcs of the Misty Mountains which by chance or design had descended from the mountains
column5: and the Dúnedain were backed against the river in a hopeless situation.

column1: At this time the Éothéod under their leader Eorl suddenly appeared
column3: as they were belatedly responding to a previous request by Cirion. The Éothéod crossed the Anduin at the Undeeps of the river
column4: and broke on the rearguard of the Balchoth. The Balchoth were completely defeated and the Gondorian armies saved. The Éothéod continued their foray into northern Gondor
column5: scattering and destroying all the Balchoth in Calenardhon.

column1: Three months after the Battle the Steward of Gondor Cirion gave the Éothéod the entire land of Calenardhon in which to dwell
column2: in return for their service. The Éothéod founded the Kingdom of Rohan there.
